newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER-RODA WIN DUTCH CUP FOR FIRST TIME.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-RODA WIN DUTCH CUP FOR FIRST TIME.

text.p: Roda JC Kerkrade won the Dutch Cup for the first time in their history on Thursday when they beat Heerenveen in 4-2 in the final.
Three times runners-up, Roda began the match in a sold-out Feyenoord Stadium in aggressive style.
And they took the lead after just five minutes when Gerald Sibon, who will replace Patrick Kluivert at Ajax next season, headed home a Eric van de Luer free kick.
Seven minutes later Russian striker Igor Korneev, who next season joins Feyenoord, levelled for Heerenveen when his free kick went through the hands of Roda keeper Ruud Hesp.
Roda regained the lead in the 16th minute when Van de Luer's corner was headed in by defender Gerrie Senden.
Four minutes after halftime Van de Luer cashed in on a defensive mix-up to fire in a shot from the edge of the box to make it 3-1.
And in the 59th minute Maarten Schops made sure of Roda's victory when he scored his team's fourth.
Jeffrey Talan pulled another back seven minutes from the end but it was too late for Heerenveen, who lost 6-2 to Ajax in the 1993 final.

Roda: 1-Ruud Hesp, 2-Gerrie Senden, 3-Regilio Vrede, 4-Maarten Schops, 5-Ramon van Haaren (18-Marc Luypers 89), 6-Andre Ooijer, 7-Van de Luer (15-Stephan van der Heyden 76), 8-Arno Doomernik, 9-Peter van Houdt, 10-Gerald Sibon, 11-Garba Lawal (12-Jan-Pieter Martens 69).

Heerenveen: 1-Hans Vonk, 2-Ole Tobiassen, 3-Jan de Visser, 4-Johan Hansma, 5-Tom Sier (15-Mark Nygaard 70), 6-Alex Pastoor, (18-Borre Meinseth 64) 7-Jeffrey Talan, 8-Igor Korneev, 9-Leeroy Echteld, 10-Jon Dahl Tomasson, 11-Boudewijn Pahlplatz (12-Romeo Wouden 56).
